poem:
"An Elegant Invasion"

The Groucho Club, mistress of mirth,
Spoils of Soho, now gives birth,
In the heart of Yorkshire, new tales will unfurl,
London's wild child entering a quieter world,
Bretton Hall awaits, with open lands,
For the club's first child, with unsteady hands,
Shall it bring fire, or a humble charm,
To the sweet, tranquil English farm?
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "‘Why would we go to America first?’ London’s Groucho Club to open in Yorkshire The Groucho Club, the private members’ club known for its hell-raising 39-year history in the heart of London’s Soho is expanding for the first time to an unlikely location: the heart of the West Yorkshire countryside. The club’s first outpost will be located at Bretton Hall in Wakefield, the former arts education facility that sits within the grounds of the Yorkshire". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
